alert.note: Alert for Beaufort (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 2:22PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Beaufort. * WHEN...Until 315 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 218 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a nearly stationary line of showers and thunderstorms moving across the northern portions of Hilton Head Island. As much as 2 to 3 inches of rain has already fallen, mainly along and north of Highway 278 and Business Highway 278. As additional rain falls and high tide approaches, there will be a risk for minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hilton Head Island, Hilton Head Airport, Folly Field and Shelter Cove.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
